meanings.definition: To assign a different value or meaning to something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to transvalue the old necklace by turning it into a keychain.
meanings.sent2: The artist transvalued the traditional painting style by incorporating modern elements.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he transvalued his boring chores into exciting adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her perspective on life completely transvalued after the near-death experience.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to transvalue ordinary objects into precious gems.

meanings.definition: To change the worth or significance of something.
meanings.sent1: The charity event helped transvalue the community's perception of giving back.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected win transvalued his opinion of his own abilities.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes transvalued the seriousness of the situation into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise transvalued the dark night into a hopeful morning.
meanings.sent5: Her words had the power to transvalue sadness into joy.
